abstract: Officials say that nationwide listeria outbreak that has killed 25 people who ate tainted cantaloupe was likely caused by unsanitary conditions in the packing shed of Jensen Farms, in Granada, Colo, where the melons were grown; outbreak is the deadliest caused by foodborne disease since 1985 with a total of 123 people in 26 states affected.
snippet: The outbreak, the deadliest incident of foodborne illness in the last 25 years, grew out of unsanitary conditions at a Colorado farm, investigators found.
lead_paragraph: The outbreak, the deadliest incident of foodborne illness in the last 25 years, grew out of unsanitary conditions at a Colorado farm, investigators found.

headline.main: Listeria Outbreak Traced to Cantaloupe Packing Shed
headline.seo: Listeria Outbreak Traced to Colorado Cantaloupe Packing Shed
